chunks.chunk_text: China faces the harshest treatment with a staggering 54% tariff on virtually all Chinese imports starting April 9th.This rate could climb even higher to 79% if Trump follows through with his threat to impose an additional 25% tariff on nations purchasing oil from Venezuela which includes China.Other major trading partners receiving severe tariff rates include Vietnam at 46%
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: and Taiwan at 32%.According to calculations by the Non-partisan Tax Foundation, these measures could cost the average American household an additional $2,100 annually for consumer goods.The impact will be felt most acutely across products heavily imported from the targeted countries.Consumer electronics like laptops, tablets and smartphones, primarily sourced from China, Vietnam and Taiwan,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: will likely see significant price increases.The footwear and toy industries will also be hard hit, with China and Vietnam supplying nearly 70% of all shoes and 77% of toys sold in the United States.Industry experts predict price hikes of at least 30% for Chinese-made toys once current inventories are depleted, with noticeable increases expected by late summer.Clothing will similarly be affected
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: as China and Vietnam each shipped approximately $14 billion worth of apparel to the US last year.Trump's tariff calculations have stunned economists with their unorthodox methodology.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: This approach targets countries with large trade surpluses relative to their exports to America regardless of their actual tariff policies.This resulted in some surprising outcomes, including Lesotho receiving the highest tariff rate of 50% despite having a trade deficit with the US of only $234 million compared to China's $295 billion.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: Only goods from Mexico and Canada have a chance of avoiding these new tariffs, though existing 25% tariffs will remain on their exports that don't comply with the United States-Mexico-Canada agreement.As businesses determine how much of these increased costs to absorb or pass on to consumers, Americans are left wondering not if prices will rise, but when and by how much, as the effects
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: ripple through supply chains in the coming months.Now let's go on to keyword drills.Our first keyword, substantial.Sub-stan-shill.When something is described as substantial, it is described as very large in amount or importance.Example sentence, the tariffs will cause substantial price increases for American consumers buying imported goods.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: Next keyword, calculations.When we are talking about calculation, we are referring to the process of using numbers to find an amount.Example sentence, according to calculations by the tax foundation, these tariffs could cost each American household an extra $2,100 per year.Next keyword,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: noticeable.When something is noticeable, it is described as easy to see or easy to recognize.Example sentence, industry experts predict noticeable increases in toy prices by late summer once current supplies run out.Next keyword, reciprocal.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_國際時事跟讀 Ep.K971_ 川普關稅戰開打全球價格動盪 Global Price Shock_ Trumps Tariff War Begins.json

chunks.chunk_text: Reciprocal means something is given or done in return.Example sentence, Trump called the tariffs reciprocal but they don't actually match the rates other countries charge on American goods.Last keyword, ripple.When something ripples, it's to spread gradually through a medium.Example sentence, the effects of these new tariffs

chunks.chunk_text: will ripple through supply chains in the coming months, affecting prices across many products.
